---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e14702f4c7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21399/commits/e14702f4c7a7b82a6c3374176c5408a81165f230)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.ChosenFiniteProducts.Over` (new file)|590|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ associator_hom_left_fst`
`+ associator_hom_left_snd_fst`
`+ associator_hom_left_snd_snd`
`+ associator_inv_left_fst`
`+ associator_inv_left_fst_snd`
`+ associator_inv_left_snd`
`+ braiding_hom_left`
`+ braiding_inv_left`
`+ chosenFiniteProducts`
`+ hom`
`+ leftUnitor_hom_left`
`+ leftUnitor_inv_left_fst`
`+ leftUnitor_inv_left_snd`
`+ mk_hom`
`+ rightUnitor_hom_left`
`+ rightUnitor_inv_left_fst`
`+ rightUnitor_inv_left_snd`
`+ tensorHom_left`
`+ tensorHom_left_fst`
`+ tensorHom_left_snd`
`+ tensorObj_ext`
`+ tensorObj_hom`
`+ tensorObj_left`
`+ tensorUnit_hom`
`+ tensorUnit_left`
`+ whiskerLeft_left`
`+ whiskerLeft_left_fst`
`+ whiskerLeft_left_snd`
`+ whiskerRight_left`
`+ whiskerRight_left_fst`
`+ whiskerRight_left_snd`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

@erdOne 
Just wanted to mention that this PR is welcome, and can be useful for me in the development of LCCCs in #21525.

I proved a similar fact to your `chosenFiniteProducts`.   
```
def isBinaryProductSigmaReindex (Y Z : Over X) :
     IsLimit <| BinaryFan.mk (P:= Σ_ Y (Δ_ Y Z)) (π_ Y Z) (μ_ Y Z) := by
```     
My strategy there was to get the monoidal API via the following instances 
```
attribute [local instance] ChosenFiniteProducts.ofFiniteProducts
attribute [local instance] monoidalOfChosenFiniteProducts
```
I was wondering if there is an advantage in explicitly constraining monoidal structure on `Over` as you do here rather than refactoring through `ChosenFiniteProducts.ofFiniteProducts`. I am asking because I want to understand better how things work in mathlib regarding `HasFiniteProducts` and `ChosenFiniteProducts` when it comes to providing/using cartesian monoidal structures.

The motivation behind this PR is a applicational one: some lemmas in algebraic geometry are only written for pullbacks and it would be useful if the structure maps of group schemes coincides with them.

> The motivation behind this PR is a applicational one: some lemmas in algebraic geometry are only written for pullbacks and it would be useful if the structure maps of group schemes coincides with them.

That makes sense. I guess what you want would not be possible with `ChosenFiniteProducts.ofFiniteProducts` since it uses choice.
I am not sure we want these to be simp lemmas.

We should have a definition saying that this binary fan IsLimit in Over X provided that the underlying square IsPullback, and then you can use that here. This specific product defined as a pullback shows up in elementary topos theory as well in a fundamental way. In fact `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Constructions.Over.Products` gives the Has version of all this. Can you use / generalise that to give these? More specifically, I think we should have the IsBinaryProduct implies IsPullback versions, and everything else deduced from that.

Ha, there's a prehistoric version of this here: https://github.com/b-mehta/topos/blob/c9032b11789e36038bc841a1e2b486972421b983/src/category/binary_products.lean#L271. I think that's what ended up being the construction I link above, but I'm not sure of the history. I have no doubt you can write something nicer :)

> Ha, there's a prehistoric version of this here: https://github.com/b-mehta/topos/blob/c9032b11789e36038bc841a1e2b486972421b983/src/category/binary_products.lean#L271. I think that's what ended up being the construction I link above, but I'm not sure of the history. I have no doubt you can write something nicer :)

Just a quick comment that the converse, i.e. `IsBinaryProduct` in `Over` implies `IsPullback` in `C` is already in 
`Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Constructions.Over.Products`: 
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/75cc82bc3c772436d560d7cd872019cf3c5cf224/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Constructions/Over/Products.lean#L173

I think what you perhaps want here is the converse, no? maybe can be stated in the same file?
Oops, you're right. I shouldn't be thinking about over categories at 2am, clearly!

I should be more specific: the construction used in `over_binaryProduct_of_pullback` is the one I think should have an `Is` version (and currently doesn't, but the converse does), and that should be used to prove both `over_binaryProduct_of_pullback` and the new result here.

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory): `ChosenFiniteProducts (Over X)`
